div.p: RELAND, ADRIAN (1676-1718), Dutch Orientalist, was born at Ryp, studied at Utrecht and Leiden, and was professor of Oriental languages successively at Harderwijk (1699) and Utrecht (1701). His most important works were Palaestina ex Veteribus monumentis Ulustrata (Utrecht, 1714), and Anliquitates sacrae velerum Hebraeorum. (See also Burman, Traj. Erud., p.296 seq.).
